meanings.definition: A harsh, shrill cry or sound.
meanings.sent1: The scraich of the seagulls filled the air by the beach.
meanings.sent2: I heard a scraich in the distance and knew it was a cat in trouble.
meanings.sent3: The scraich of the baby startled the sleeping dog, making it jump up in surprise.
meanings.sent4: The scraich of the brakes echoed through the quiet street, signaling the arrival of the ambulance.
meanings.sent5: The scraich of the microphone feedback made everyone cover their ears in pain.

meanings.definition: To make a harsh, shrill cry or sound.
meanings.sent1: The owl would scraich loudly at night, keeping us awake.
meanings.sent2: I scraiched for help when I saw the snake slithering towards me.
meanings.sent3: The children scraiched with laughter as they played in the park.
meanings.sent4: The old door scraiched open slowly, revealing a hidden room.
meanings.sent5: She scraiched in fear when she saw the spider crawling towards her.

meanings.sent1: The scraich of the thunder shook the windows of the house.
meanings.sent2: The scraich of the car engine indicated it needed immediate repair.
meanings.sent3: The scraich of the music blaring from the party next door kept me up all night.
meanings.sent4: The scraich of the chalk on the blackboard made everyone cringe.
meanings.sent5: The scraich of the brakes screeched through the silent night, causing heads to turn.
